newsitem.title: USA: Asset Investors adviser sold for $11.45 mln.
newsitem.headline: Asset Investors adviser sold for $11.45 mln.

text.p: Asset Investors Corp said Wednesday that its external adviser, Financial Asset Management LLC, was sold by M.D.C. Holdings Inc for $11.45 million.
Financial Asset Management was sold to FAM Acquisition LLC, a newly formed company that will be owned by an investment group led by Terry Considine and Thomas Rhodes, it said.
The purchase price included $6 million in cash and $5.45 million in notes issued by FAM Acquisition LLC to M.D.C. Holdings.
After related expenses, M.D.C. will report an after-tax gain of about $2.5 million, or $0.11 per fully diluted share, in the third quarter of 1996, M.D.C. Holdings said.
Asset Investors, a real estate investment trust, said the transaction will not lead to a change in its management agreement with Financial Asset.

Considine is chairman, president and chief executive of Apartment Investment and Management Co, a real estate investment trust. Rhodes is president and director of National Review Inc and previously was a general partner at Goldman, Sachs & Co.

As part of the transaction, Larry Mizel - chairman, president and chief executive of M.D.C., and Spencer Browne, president of Financial Asset, and a director, president and chief executive of Asset Investors, resigned as directors and officers of Asset Investors.
Browne also resigned from his positions as president, chief executive and a director of Commercial Assets Inc, an affiliate of Asset Investors.
The vacancies on the Asset Investors board are to be filled by Considine, who has been named chairman and co-chief executive, and Rhodes, who has been appointed vice chairman and co-chief executive.
Leslie Fox has been named president and chief operating officer of Asset Investors. Fox most recently was the company's chief operating officer.
